Johnson Says U.S. House Will Vote on Stalled Aid to Israel and Ukraine

Speaker Mike Johnson said he would bring up a spending package along with a bill aimed at mollifying Republicans who have been opposed to backing Kyiv.

4 min read

Inside the Manhattan Courtroom Where Donald Trump Is on Trial

Protesters railed outside as media and security swarmed the area. In the courtroom, the former president, who is facing criminal charges, appeared to nod off.

4 min read

As jury selection began, dozens of prospective jurors told a judge they could not be impartial and were dismissed.

6 min read

Here are five takeaways from the first day of the hush-money trial.

April 15, 2024, 8:34 p.m. ET

World Leaders Urge Restraint as Israel Weighs Retaliation Against Iran

Israel’s war cabinet met again to discuss how to respond to Iran’s assault. Far-right members of the Israeli government called for swift action.

 

Analysis

Iran’s Strike on Israel Creates Military Uncertainty and Diplomatic Opportunity

Analysts feared Iran’s strikes might set off a wider war. But with Israel still weighing its response, the attack’s consequences have yet to be determined.

5 min read

The unraveling of the 2015 Iran nuclear deal and a rise in tensions have made containing Tehran more fraught, experts said.

6 min read

Pro-Palestinian protesters shut down traffic in U.S. cities, part of a global effort to push for a cease-fire in Gaza.

2 min read

The Widest-Ever Global Coral Crisis Will Hit Within Weeks, Scientists Say

Rising sea temperatures around the planet have caused a bleaching event that is expected to be the most extensive on record.

4 min read

What’s Killing Endangered Sawfish in Florida?

First, fish off the Florida Keys starting swimming in spirals or upside down. Then, endangered sawfish started dying. Scientists are racing to figure out why.

5 min read

The Great Read

Online Dating After 50 Can Be Miserable. But It’s Also Liberating.

You know so much more about yourself and your desires when you’re older that dating apps — even with all their frustrations — can bring unanticipated pleasure.

18 min read

On Himalayan Hillsides Grows Japan’s Cold, Hard Cash

A shrub in impoverished Nepal now supplies the raw material for the bank notes used in Asia’s most sophisticated financial system.

4 min read

Justices Clear Way for Idaho to Ban Transgender Treatment for Minors

The Supreme Court has temporarily allowed a state law that would ban gender-affirming medical care for minors to go into effect.

4 min read

More competition and flagging demand for electric vehicles have led to declining sales at Tesla.

2 min read

Tesla plans to lay off more than 10 percent of its work force.

5 min read

1 min read

New Migrants Get Work Permits. Other Undocumented Immigrants Want Them, Too.

Long-term undocumented immigrants in the U.S. — and their employers — are feeling left out by policies allowing most who just crossed the border to work legally.

6 min read

Which A.I. system writes the best computer code or generates the most realistic image? There’s no easy way to answer those questions, our columnist writes.

Instagram is testing a program that allows its top influencers to interact with followers using a chatbot.
